snippet: Assisted reproductive technology fails much more often — and leaves more scars — than we are led to believe.
abstract: Op-Ed article by authors Miriam Zoll and Pamela Tsigdinos warns of the seductive appeal of assisted reproductive technology, in light of their personal experiences with failed treatments; notes such technology fails much more than it works, and long-term health risks are still largely unknown; calls for reining in the hype and taking a more realistic look at myths surrounding infertility and science's ability to 'cure' it.

byline.original: By MIRIAM ZOLL and PAMELA TSIGDINOS

lead_paragraph: Assisted reproductive technology fails much more often — and leaves more scars — than we are led to believe.
